Author: zawy#5864
Content: I would like to delve into "currency as a ball of energy storage and transfer" but I need to model kmd's RST+Digi+exp.  But here's my article on curerncy.  https://zawy1.blogspot.com/2019/02/all-properties-of-money-are-derived.html

Author: zawy#5864
Content: The ideal currency  is constant value in all context As part if this it is proportional to the net work (energy) output for a given  time period (velocity) of the commodity infrastructure that it controls. It's the control of net work.    However, 3 people actually showing an interest (or misunderstanding that I was being both serious and ridiculous)  in "ball of energy" got me thinking about it.  The ball of energy is not supposed to be exactly energy, but should store,  transfer, and release of  net work energy.  Joules of heat are completely useless, or at least wasteful if driging a steam engine.   But look at this: we work for money and that work we do puts some amount of net energy into society.  Then we spend that money to extract net work energy back out.  So although it is more immediately precise to say money is control of net work energy, the amount of currency in our hand is a control of a ball of energy floating around in society.  If law and economics are acting correctly we put that energy out there in exchange for the bills and the bills can extract it back out.

Author: zawy#5864
Content: Szabo's comments on currency are very interesing and true. He reveals some interesting things such as pointing out a history of use and cost of creation are often the foundation of money.  This is extremely important to how we view BTC.  My article is trying to give a better and deeper picture  of the forest.
